revised_title: George Edward Briggs: A Pioneering Plant Physiologist and Educator
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Physiology
tldr: This biographical memoir highlights the life and work of George Edward Briggs, a prominent plant physiologist and educator. Briggs made significant contributions to the field of plant physiology, emphasizing the quantitative approach and influencing generations of students at Cambridge University. He was elected as a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1935 and served as a professor of plant physiology and botany at Cambridge.
